Key Arguments: The legislation communicates distrust in the public's ability to discern truth.
The government assumes it can determine the truth better than the public.
The bill promotes an undemocratic 'us and them' mentality.
An informed public should be responsible for discerning fact from fiction.
No group, especially unelected bureaucrats, should be the sole source of truth.
Main Themes: Criticism of centralized control over information
Notable Quotes: The proposed ‘Misinformation Bill’ is a disaster.
The government should trust the Australian public with the responsibility to discern fact from fiction.
This bill should be laughed out of existence.
This is a very sad time in our life when we are robbed of free speech.
